collisionHandler¶

This file contains all of the functions involved in calculating collisions. Here’s a rundown on what all of the function do:

collisionHandler.normalize()¶

Normalizes the given vector.

Parameters

vector (np.array([float, float])) – A 2 dimensional vector.

Returns

The given vector normalized.

Return type

np.array([float, float])


collisionHandler.findNormalForce()¶

Takes a motionVector (representing the vector formed by an entity’s _priorPosition and _position) and a surface object, then returns the component of the motionVector normal to the surface.

Parameters

  • motionVector (np.array([float, float])) – A 2 dimensional vector.

  • surface (environment.surface()) – A surface object.

Returns

The component of the motionVector normal to the surface.

Return type

np.array([float, float])


collisionHandler.pointInBounds()¶

Takes a point and two tuples, representing upper/lower x/y bounds, respectively, and returns a boolean indicating whether the point is located in those bounds.

Parameters

  • point (np.array(float, float)) – A point in 2D space.

  • xBounds ((float, float)) – The upper/lower x bounds (the order doesn’t matter)

  • yBounds ((float, float)) – The upper/lower y bounds (the order doesn’t matter)

Returns

A boolean indicating whether the point is in the given bounds.

Return type

bool

2DPhysicsEngine
